value.0: I awoke to the sound of thunder and the crashing of waves above and all around me. On deck, Captain Jord had lashed himself to the tiller, steering a hazardous course towards a dim light that pierced through the rain on our starboard side. In what may be the longest hour of my life, he sailed us to the relative safety of this unknown island port. It shows signs of life despite the storm and great bonfires whip in the wind and rain at the island's peak.

It shows signs of life despite the storm and great bonfires whip in the wind and rain at the island's peak. Captain Jord has urged me to climb that summit and announce our presence while he secures the ship and battens down the hatches.

Captain Jord has urged me to climb that summit and announce our presence while he secures the ship and battens down the hatches. On the way up, I encountered a young guard named Christer. Acting on the orders of a certain Lord Eremor, he seems to be in quite a hurry to seal himself into a nearby crypt. Christer urged me to seek out this Eremor in the keep at the island's summit and direct my questions there.

Captain Jord urged me to climb that summit and announce our presence while he secured the ship and battened down the hatches. On the way up, I encountered a young guard named Christer. Acting on the orders of a certain Lord Eremor, he seemed to be in quite a hurry to seal himself into a nearby crypt. In speaking to that Lord Eremor in the keep on the island's well-guarded summit, I have learned that both Jord and Christer are doomed men. Apparently this storm is the work of an long-dead pirate by the name of Morgroth, whose undead hordes are crawling out of the seas even now. Poor, doomed Christer, sealed into the crypt for the keep's protection, will become a vessel for the spirit of this vengeful pirate.

Lord Eremor tells me that this storm is an annual curse and that the only way to put an end to it is to kill Morgroth in the dock-side crypts. It is a foul task and not one he dares ask of his men, all of whom knew Christer well. It seems that it has fallen upon me to put an end to this dreadful curse once and for all. Once I have killed Morgroth, Lord Eremor wants me to return to him with the pirate's undead heart as evidence of the deed.

NOTE: Congratualtions, you have successfully completed "The Winds of Eremor." At Lord Eremor's invitation, you are welcome to stay and help defend the keep against Morgroth's undead army for as long as you wish. When you are ready to end your adventure, simply go inside and speak to Lord Eremor.
